intro: Pavonia guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste pavonia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red bract-like flowers that are often mistaken for petals. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Pavonia guanacastensis is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
